description: Adding filesharing options in folder properties UI is essential

Endless trouble trying to detect my SMB drive ... why?? Just just installed and tried Krusader file manager, and instantly boom there was my drive! Why is there no simple way to scan for an external SMB drive? There's no way i can find! Reall frustrating and disappointing for Dolphin file manager!

Directory is shared but it is impossible FROM THE SAME COMPUTER to get access via Dolphin -> Network -> SMB :( even if i grant full control to everybody.
No access from another computer.
The sharing tab in properties is empty. Doesnt work.

Creating smb shared folders in Ubuntu takes a couple of simple terminal cmds and small edit of smb.conf.
sudo install samba
then add these 2 lines to the [Global] section of /etc/samba/smb.conf
client min protocol = SMB2
usershare owner only = false
Back to the terminal
sudo smbpasswd -a username #must be valid system username
enter new password
sudo service smbd restart
sudo ufw allow samba
 Then right click any folder anywhere and choose Local Network Share from the context menu, tick the share box and click ok, job done, folder shared.

Manjaro KDE, providing you install using the correct terminal command.
"pamac install samba kdenetwork-filesharing manjaro-settings-samba"
Right click any folder>properties>share[tab]
tick the box and create a network share, unbelievably simples.

Fedora KDE with Dolphin on the other hand, days later, unimmaginable number of tutorials followed, many, many reinstalls, hundreds of cmds in the konsole, dozens of files edited, I've come to the conclusion that it is impossible to create a simple Network Shared Folder in Fedora, GUI or konsole.
Tuely staggering that in 2022 when peoples homes and businesses are more networked than ever, sharing media/music/movies and files around thier properties to various devices, is so easy to setup in every other Distro and Operating System except Fedora.

And without samba/smb folder sharing the entire distro is completely useless, steer well clear.
summary: Impossible to share folders on Fedora
